thread.title: Former prison worker charged for helping NY escapees
thread.title_full: Former prison worker charged for helping NY escapees - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: WCAX News
title: Former prison worker charged for helping NY escapees
text:
PLATTSBURGH, N.Y. - A former corrections officer will be charged for helping two killers escape the Dannemora prison.
Gene Palmer of Cadyville is accused of supplying pliers, a screwdriver, and paint to David Sweat and Richard Matt who broke out of the prison. Palmer will be arraigned Friday. Another prison worker, Joyce Mitchell, was sentenced to two to seven years in prison for her role in the escape.
Matt was shot and killed while the men were on the run. Sweat was captured by authorities.
